query: Build a modern, mobile responsive Website on NextJS, with a CMS backend for full CRUD blog, videos, text, images etc. SEO ready
key_findings: Utilize Next.js's built-in static site generation (SSG) and server-side rendering (SSR) capabilities to optimize your blog's performance and SEO. Leverage 'getStaticProps' and 'getServerSideProps' for fetching data efficiently.

Choose a headless CMS like Strapi, Contentful, or Sanity for managing your blog content. These platforms provide RESTful or GraphQL APIs that can be easily integrated with Next.js for full CRUD operations.
Implement responsive design using CSS frameworks like Tailwind CSS or styled-components to ensure your website is mobile-friendly. Use Next.js's Image component for optimized image loading.
Follow best practices for SEO by using Next.js's built-in 'next/head' component to manage meta tags dynamically for each page, ensuring proper indexing by search engines.
Avoid common pitfalls by ensuring that your API calls are optimized and do not block rendering. Use Next.js's 'getStaticPaths' for dynamic routes to pre-render pages at build time.
Integrate authentication for your CMS backend using JWT or OAuth, depending on your CMS capabilities. Ensure secure API access by validating tokens on the server side.
Utilize Next.js's API routes for backend logic if needed, but consider offloading heavy processing to serverless functions to maintain performance.
Implement caching strategies, such as using SWR or React Query for data fetching, to minimize API calls and improve user experience.
Ensure your application is secure by following OWASP guidelines, such as validating and sanitizing user inputs, especially when dealing with content uploads.
Regularly monitor performance metrics using tools like Google Lighthouse and optimize your Next.js application based on the insights gathered.

code_examples.description: Next.js API route to fetch blog posts from Strapi
Using Next.js Image component for optimized images

best_practices: Use static site generation (SSG) for pages that do not change frequently to improve performance and SEO.
Leverage Next.js's dynamic routing to create SEO-friendly URLs for blog posts and other content.
Implement structured data (JSON-LD) for blog posts to enhance search engine visibility.
Optimize images using Next.js's Image component to improve loading times and user experience.
common_pitfalls: Neglecting to implement fallback pages for dynamic routes can lead to poor user experience and SEO issues.
Overloading the initial page load with too many API calls can slow down performance; consider using incremental static regeneration.
Failing to set proper caching headers can lead to stale content being served to users.
implementation_patterns: Use a hybrid approach with SSG for static content and SSR for dynamic content to balance performance and freshness.
Implement a CMS-first approach where content is managed in the headless CMS and fetched on-demand in Next.js.
Utilize Next.js API routes to handle server-side logic and interact with the headless CMS.

integration_requirements.authentication: API keys for headless CMS, OAuth for user authentication if needed.

performance_considerations: Utilize Next.js's built-in features like Image Optimization and Automatic Static Optimization to enhance performance.
Implement lazy loading for images and videos to reduce initial load time.
Use a CDN to serve static assets and improve load times globally.
security_considerations: Ensure that API keys are stored securely and not exposed in the client-side code.
Implement CORS policies in the headless CMS to restrict access to your APIs.
Regularly update dependencies to mitigate vulnerabilities in the tech stack.
